data.title: Mathematical Relations
data.meta_description:
homology (4) - Free download as PDF File (.pdf), Text File (.txt) or read online for free. This document discusses the axiomatic definition of homology theory given by Eilenberg and Steenrod in 1945. The key points are:

1. Eilenberg and Steenrod defined what properties a category must satisfy in order to support a homology theory, including containing points and pairs/triples of spaces. 

2. An admissible category for homology theory must be closed under certain constructions like products and mappings between lattices of pairs. 

3. A homotopy between maps is defined as a map of pairs of spaces times an interval satisfying boundary conditions.
